intro: Freycinetia stonei, commonly known as the Red-veined Screw pine, is a unique flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves that are often reddish-veined, giving it a striking visual appearance. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by woody, three-lobed fruits. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is often found growing in coastal or saline environments. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
